body:
S T A T E L E S S
P U R E
I vote excluding tandon for now to make things easier.
Poor Tandon
Thanks for the PR!
This was fixed.

Looks good! Some pointers:

`Use upgrade instead of install` probably shouldn't be in the script area.

Install git has `brew install postgresql`

I'd probably break each installation into a separate code block and explain why each of the installations are necessary
Thanks for the advice. I didn't realize I have so many typos. I'll fix them and close this one
Oh don't worry about closing the PR. In the future you can just push to the same branch and notify me/Albert when you want to merge
Woohoo! Enum explanations are looking great. I'm going to make a few grammar changes on the contributing doc and then merge.
We can also solve this by moving to HTTPS  ;D
Closed because no longer happening. Who knows what was wrong.

That's my B, I haven't really documented schedge db scrape at all. The fix is to add the user `schedge` with password `docker` as a super user, and then run `gradle updateDb` to update the database schema. I'll add docs for that in `CONTRIBUTING.md` later this month
Closing in favor of #12 ; we should switch to HTTPS eventually.
You asked for changes, you got it. Yeah, I think it was excessive of me to comment so much. Thanks for pointing it out. I have made the changes

I have reached out to my friends at UMD, College Park. They have a website that is dedicated to course registration and has the feature to register using the website. UMD also uses Duo Mobile Authentification. Here is the website: https://planetterp.com/. 

I also think if we can combine professors' reviews and a feature to plan out the students' degree progress, it would be even more helpful. That will certainly make the codebase even more complex but imo, it will remove Albert from existing :)
Woohoo! Ok, merged.
Unfortunately the course catalog doesn't have this information; I'm currently working on the section scraper so we can update the DB with section information, including min and max credits

To register for courses, we will use Albert Mobile to make the requests. Normal Albert would not allow us to easily implement this feature as we have to figure out about Duo Authentication as well as how NYU Albert works. However, with Albert Mobile, these steps can be simplified. 

### Advantages
1, Albert Mobile does not require Duo Authentication (for now). 
2, We can pass into the URL, e.g:
 - Adding class with code number 13024 to Shopping Cart: https://m.albert.nyu.edu/app/student/enrollmentcart/addToCart/NYUNV/UGRD/1204/13024
=> This will prompt the user to the URL, requiring them to sign in. After signing in, they will be redirected to the URL and the request will be made. 

- Enrolling class with code 13024:
https://m.albert.nyu.edu/app/student/enrollmentcart/enrollclass/NYUNV/UGRD/1204/13024

### Takeaway
- We can pass class code to these URL, without having to deal with Duo or normal NYU Albert, to make these requests. 
- The class can only be enrolled if they are in the shopping cart. 
- We cannot pass multiple subject codes to the URL.

This will need more research after we set up everything in the backend. But it will be less painful to implement than understanding how normal Albert works
No longer broken, without changing anything; going to have to look out for this problem in the future.
Does the Courses Endpoint only serve courses for Spring 2020 for now? Because all other year and semester returns an empty lists
Yeah, it only has data for spring 2020. I can add data for others, just haven't gotten around to it.

1, Adding scraping functions with batch size given school and subject:
- This takes a bit long
- Given one school, scraping takes around 8 minutes (500 secs)
- Given no school and subject, scraping takes around 30 minutes (2000 secs)

2, Change SectionAttribute units to String since some classes have 2.5 units

3, Change Section waitlist total to Integer

You can try something like

```
./schedge scrape catalog --term 1204 --subject csci --school ua
```

To figure out commands, you can also use the `--help` flag to get more detailed information about what flags are available in each of the subcommands.
What arguments did you use when running that command?
khanh could you change the minUnits and maxUnits to `float` ? That way its faster to store and easier to use. Otherwise I love this PR; it's the business logic of the last feature we need!
Great, Thanks a lot!
This can be helpful for anyone who's running the code in a system that is not in English
I changed it
--term 1204
Thanks for the PR!
